site_number: GARAGE BLOCKS AT REAR OF 13 AND 16
description: Variation of condition 2 (approved plans) to allow for the shifting of the southern block by not more than 730 mm to the west, minor internal and external changes to Units 1 & 2 of the northern block, minor landscape alterations and substitution of the approved arboricultural impact assessment to include T13 and T15 for removal following planning permission 00289/R/O13-16/P1 dated 04/04/2022 for erection of two part-one/part-two-storey buildings comprising four flats including associated cycle storage, landscaping, refuse and recycling storage.
site_name: Garage Blocks At Rear Of 13 And 16
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from 4 April 2022, being the date of granting of planning permission 00289/R/O13-16/P1.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (337-P14-00, 337-P14-01, 337-P14-02, Cover Letter, Daylight and Sunlight Report, Design and Access Statement, Energy and Sustainability Statement, Fire Safety Statement, Landmark Contaminated Land Report, Notice Letter, Planning Statement, Preliminary Ecological Appraisal, Preliminary Bat Roost Assessment, SUDs Assessment Report, Statement of Community Involvement, London Development Database Management and Transport Statement. Received on 17 January 2022; Addendum Daylight Report. Received on 15 February 2022; Thames Water Pre-planning Enquiry Letter. Received on 15 March 2022; 22055 P-03, 22055 P-04, 22055 P-04-1, 22055 P-05, 22055 P-06, 22055 P-07, 22055 P-08, 22055 P-08-1, 22055 P-09, 22055 P-10 and Arboricultural Impact Assessment. Received on 26/06/2023; Notice Letter. Received on 05/06/2023) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the buildings are used.
Condition : 3 - The development shall not be implemented other than in accordance with the materials approved under 00289/R/013-16/P1(3).

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to the occupation of the hereby approved development, details of hard and soft landscaping shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved details and maintained in accordance with such thereafter. Any trees or plants that, within 5 years of planting, die, are cut down, uprooted, destroyed or become (in the opinion of the Local Planning Authority) seriously damaged or defective, shall be replaced with another tree or plant of the same size and species within the first planting season following its death, removal, uprooting or destruction, unless the Local Planning Authority gives its prior written approval to any variation.

Condition : 5 - Prior to the occupation of the hereby approved development, a detailed plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected along the front, side and rear of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The boundary treatment shall be completed before the development is occupied or in accordance with a timetable agreed in writing with the local planning authority.

Condition : 6 - The development hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and any subsequent approved revisions. 

Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, performance data for energy consumption must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The performance data shall be submitted every 18 months to a monitoring web-platform for a period of three years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 7 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.

Condition : 8 - The development hereby approved, shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following: 
At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification. 
At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme. 
No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 9 - All windows serving bathrooms of the hereby approved development as shown on drawing numbers 22055 P-04, 22055 P-04-1, 22055 P-05, 22055 P-08 and 22055 P-10 shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.
Condition : 10 - The development shall take place in accordance with the details contained within the approved Constructions Logistics Plan under 00289/R/O13-16/P1(10).

Condition : 11 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8am to 6pm on Mondays to Friday and 9am to 1pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 12 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved full details (including manufacturers specifications) of secure covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than eight bicycles) for the occupants of each dwelling and short-stay cycle parking facilities (for not less than two bicycles) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 
The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 13 - Prior to first occupation of the hereby approved development a waste management strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show how waste will be managed on site specifically on waste collection days. 
Waste management shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 14 - Following approval of details under 00289/R/O13-16/P1(14) and before the development is first brought into use: 
If additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development, the agreed scheme for decontamination referred to in clause c), shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report referred to in clause d), shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.

Condition : 15 - Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), the applicant shall have submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing a final detailed drainage design, including drawings and supporting calculations [and an updated Drainage Assessment Form to be reviewed and approved by the Lead Local Flood Authority. The drainage hierarchy shall make use of green infrastructure technology to comply with the hierarchy set out in London Plan Policy SI 13 and the runoff rate should not exceed 2.5 litres/second. A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components shall also be submitted and approved which demonstrates how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development. The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the approved details.

Condition : 16 - No part of the development hereby permitted shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and copies of installation contracts, along with a written confirmation) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme hereby approved has been completed in accordance with the submitted final detailed drainage designs. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.
Condition : 17 - The hereby approved development must be carried out in accordance with the recommendations approved in the Preliminary Ecological Appraisal received on 17 January 2022.

Condition : 18 - Prior to occupation, the development shall achieve 'Secured by Design' accreditation awarded by the Design-Out Crime Officer from the Metropolitan Police Service on behalf of the Association of Chief Police Officers (ACPO). No part of the development shall be occupied until accreditation has been achieved and evidence of such accreditation has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority.
